Supports TDD, debugging, refactoring, and learning sessions. Features automatic role switching, continuous code review, security scanning, and performance optimization with truth-score verification.

security_audit.summary: The pair-programming skill is a documentation file for a CLI tool that facilitates AI-assisted pair programming. While the documentation itself poses no direct security risks, it describes a tool with significant capabilities including command execution, file system access, and network integration. The tool requires careful implementation of security controls for safe deployment.

medium_findings.title: Command Injection Risk in CLI Interface
medium_findings.description: The documentation shows CLI commands that accept user input without validation examples. Commands like 'claude-flow pair --agent senior-dev' could be vulnerable to injection if inputs are not sanitized.

medium_findings.title: Unrestricted File System Access
medium_findings.description: The tool saves/loads sessions and configuration files without showing access controls or sandboxing. Session persistence features could access sensitive files.

medium_findings.title: Code Execution Without Verification
medium_findings.description: Commands like '/implement' and '/refactor' trigger code generation and execution without showing verification steps or sandboxing mechanisms.

low_findings.title: Environment Variable Exposure
low_findings.description: Configuration via environment variables (CLAUDE_PAIR_*) without mention of sensitive data protection or leakage prevention.

low_findings.title: Supply Chain Dependency Risk
low_findings.description: Requires 'claude-flow@alpha' installation via npm without mentioning package integrity verification or dependency scanning.

content.user_title: AI Pair Programming Assistant for Real-Time Code Collaboration
content.value_statement: Solo coding leads to blind spots and quality issues. AI pair programming provides instant feedback, continuous review, and collaborative problem-solving.
actual_capabilities: Multiple collaboration modes: driver, navigator, switch, TDD, review, mentor, debug
Real-time verification with 0.95+ truth score accuracy and automatic rollback
Integrated testing with coverage tracking and continuous test execution
Role-based collaboration with seamless driver/navigator switching
Built-in code review with security scanning and performance analysis
Session persistence with metrics tracking and export capabilities
limitations: Requires Claude Flow CLI installation and npm package dependencies
Session duration limited to 4 hours with 15-minute idle timeout
Verification threshold minimum 0.90 may block some legitimate code changes
Background sessions require manual attachment and lack authentication controls

use_cases.title: Learn coding patterns with AI mentor
use_cases.description: Practice implementing features with AI guidance, explanations, and real-time feedback on code quality.

use_cases.title: Rapid prototyping with AI navigator
use_cases.description: Quickly build prototypes by directing AI to write boilerplate code while focusing on architecture decisions.

use_cases.title: Consistent code reviews and testing
use_cases.description: Maintain code quality standards across team with automated reviews, testing, and best practice enforcement.

output_examples.input: Check session status during pair programming

best_practices: Define clear session goals upfront and choose appropriate mode for your task type
Enable verification for critical code paths and maintain truth scores above 0.95
Run tests continuously and review security before committing any changes
anti_patterns: Avoid long sessions without breaks - take breaks every 45-60 minutes
Never disable verification for production code or sensitive features
Do not ignore truth score warnings - investigate causes before proceeding

faq.question: Is this compatible with my existing development tools?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with any IDE or editor and integrates with Git, testing frameworks, and linters.

faq.question: What are the session time limits?
faq.answer: Sessions auto-end after 4 hours with 15-minute idle timeout, but you can save and resume anytime.

faq.question: How does it integrate with my workflow?
faq.answer: It runs in terminal alongside your tools, with commands for Git, testing, and IDE integration.

faq.question: Is my code data safe and private?
faq.answer: Sessions are local by default. Cloud features require explicit opt-in with encryption for data transfer.

faq.question: Session disconnected - how do I recover?
faq.answer: Use 'claude-flow pair --recover' to restore from auto-save or check '.claude-flow/sessions' for backups.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub Copilot?
faq.answer: This provides true collaboration with role switching, verification scores, and comprehensive testing integration.
